resources.string: \"AND\" logic gates switch on when\n both inputs are on.
\"OR\" logic gates switch on when\n at least one input is on.
\"XOR\" logic gates switch on when\n an odd number of inputs is on.
\"NOT\" logic gates have a single input\n and invert its signal.
A \"Timer Switch\" switches on for a set\n amount of time then switches off.
A \"Clock Switch\" switches on and off\n indefinitely, waiting for a short amount of time\n in between.

A "More Than Light" turns on if more
 than a set amount of inputs are turned on.
 In this example, you need to turn
 at least 2 switches on

A "Normal Light" turns on if exactly 
 a set amount of inputs are turned on.
 In this example, you need to turn
 exactly 2 switches on
An \"Even Light\" turns on if an even\n number of inputs are turned on
An \"Odd Light\" turns on if an odd\n number of inputs are turned on
